questions.Q: Given the function $$y=10x^3+2$$. If we plot $$y$$ as a function of $$x^3$$ we obtain:

A.opt: A straight line with slope  equals 10 intercepting the y-axis at $$y=2$$.
A straight line with slope  equals 3 intercepting the y-axis at $$y=2$$

questions.E: If we make the change of varible $$X=x^3$$ in the equation $$y=10x^3+2$$ it becomes $$y=10X+2$$. By plotting $$y$$ as a function $$X$$ we get a straight line with slope 10 and y-intercept the point $$(0,2)$$

questions.Q: The frequency of oscillation $$f$$ of a mass $$m$$ suspended from a vertical spring is given by $$f=\frac{1}{2\pi}\sqrt{\frac{k}{m}}$$ where $$k$$ is the spring constant. Out of the following plots the one that produces a stright-line graph is:
questions.E: Given $$f=\frac{1}{2\pi}\sqrt{\frac{k}{m}}\Rightarrow f^2=\frac{1}{4\pi^2}\frac{k}{m}=(\frac{1}{4\pi^2}k)\frac{1}{m}$$ So, the relationship between $$f^2$$ and $$\frac{1}{m}$$ is linear.

questions.Q: The time it takes for a car starting from rest and moving with constant acceleration $$a$$ to travel a distance $$x$$ is given by $$t=\sqrt {\frac{2x}{a}}$$. Out of the following plots the one that produces a stright-line graph is:
questions.E: Given $$t=\sqrt {\frac{2x}{a}} \Rightarrow t^2=\frac{2x}{a}=(\frac{2}{a})x$$. So, the relationship between $$t^2$$ and $$x$$ is linear.

questions.Q: The kinetic energy of a body of mass $$m$$ and speed $$v$$ is given by $$E_k=\frac{1}{2}mv^2$$. Out of the following plots the one that produces a stright-line graph is::
questions.E: Given $$E_{k}=\frac{1}{2}mv^2\Rightarrow \sqrt{E_k}=(\sqrt{\frac{1}{2}m})v\therefore \frac{1}{\sqrt{E_k}}=\sqrt{\frac{2}{m}}\frac{1}{v} $$. So, the relationship between $$\frac{1}{\sqrt{E_k}}$$ and $$\frac{1}{v}$$ is linear.

questions.Q: The period of a pendulum of length $$L$$ is given by $$T=2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}$$ where $$g$$ is the acceleration of gravity. Out of the following plots the one that produces a stright-line graph is:
questions.E: Given $$T=2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}\Rightarrow T^2=(\frac{4\pi^2}{g})L$$. So, the relationship between $$T^2$$ and $$L$$ is linear.

questions.Q: The electric force between two charges $$q_1$$ and $$q_2$$ a distance $$r$$ apart is given by $$F=k\frac{q_1q_2}{r^2}$$ where $$k$$ is a constant. Out of the following plots the one that produces a stright-line graph is:
questions.E: Given $$F=k\frac{q_1 q_2}{r^2} \Rightarrow \, \frac{1}{F}=\frac{r^2}{kq_1q_2}=(\frac{1}{kq_1q_2})r^2$$. So, the relationship between $$\frac{1}{F}$$ and $$r^2$$ is linear.

questions.Q: The magnitude of the gravtational force between two masses $$m_1$$ and $$m_2$$ a distance $$r$$ apart is given by $$F=G\frac{m_1m_2}{r^2}$$ where $$G$$ is a constant. Out of the following plots the one that produces a stright-line graph is:
questions.E: Given $$F=G\frac{m_1 m_2}{r^2} \Rightarrow \, F=(Gm_1 m_2)\frac{1}{r^2}$$. So, the relationship between $$F$$ and $$\frac{1}{r^2}$$ is linear.

questions.Q: The period of a planet around the sun is given by $$T^2=qR^3$$ where $$q$$ is a constant and R is the mean distance from the sun to the planet.Out of the following plots the one that produces a stright-line graph is:
questions.E: Given $$T^2=qR^3\Rightarrow\,T^{\frac{2}{3}}=(q^{\frac{1}{3}})R$$. So, the relationship between $$T^{\frac{2}{3}}$$ and $$R$$ is linear.

questions.Q: The power dissipated by a resistance is given by $$ P = Ri^2 $$ where $$R$$ is its electrical resistance and $$i$$ is the electrical current passing through it. Out of the following plots the one that produces a stright-line graph is:
questions.E: Given $$P=Ri^2\Rightarrow P=(R)i^2$$. So, the relationship between $$P$$ and $$i^2$$ is linear.

questions.Q: The time it takes for a stone to fall from the top of a building to the ground is given by $$t=\sqrt {\frac{2h}{g}}$$ where $$h$$ is the height of the building y $$g$$ is the acceleration due to gravity. Out of the following plots the one that produces a stright-line graph is:
questions.E: Given $$t=\sqrt {\frac{2h}{g}}\Rightarrow\,\frac{1}{t}=\sqrt {\frac{g}{2h}}=\sqrt {\frac{g}{2}}(\frac{1}{\sqrt{h}})$$. So, the relationship between $$\frac{1}{t}$$ and $$\frac{1}{h}$$ is linear.

questions.Q: When a spring is stretched or compressed, so that its length changes by an amount $$x$$, the energy stored by it is given by $$U_e=\frac{1}{2}kx^2$$ where $$k$$ is its elastic constant. Out of the following plots the one that produces a stright-line graph is:
questions.E: Given $$U_e= \frac{1}{2}kx^2 \Rightarrow\,\sqrt{U_e}=\sqrt {\frac{1}{2}k}x \therefore \frac{1}{\sqrt{U_e}}= (\sqrt{\frac{2}{k}})\frac{1}{x}$$. So, the relationship between $$\frac{1}{\sqrt{U_e}}$$ and $$\frac{1}{x}$$ is linear.
